job_title: Veteran Consultant/Research Assistant in Paxton, IL
pros: The Faculty and Staff are professional and engaged. There is a true feeling of community among the employees and student body alike. The administration is supportive for any and all efforts and initiatives which serve the Kankakee County at large.
cons: All higher education institutions in Illinois are currently struggling to find funding as the state funding for colleges has been slashed by our current IL State Governor.

pros: Took a pay cut to come to KCC. Great work environment, love my job. Can't beat the benefits - I get to take college classes for free as a full time employee. I finally get to finish my degree!
cons: Not very flexible with work from home. "That's the way we've always done it," may be something you may hear at some point.

pros: Great if you have a full schedule of classes, and some time to kill in between
cons: No room for growth, very basic responsibilities.

pros: Decent, very nice people and environment
Good benefits, decent coworkers, Fridays off in the summer.
cons: Poor upper administration. Very cliquey. No chance of advancement.
none at this time for me

pros: Fair salary and adequate work environment. Job stability for those willing to compromise educational quality and professional standards. Friendly people, diverse student population.
cons: General lack of leadership and complete disconnect between departments. Poor communication on all levels which complicates processes and creates confusion. Decisions makers do not value input from faculty/staff/students. Many policies and schedules are based on the best interests of administration and select faculty rather than the students and community they serve. It's all about who you know and align yourself with, not what you know or what skills you have to offer.

pros: The faculty has a diverse make-up and there is plenty of parking. It is accessible by bus.
cons: The bus system needs to have a direct bus from surrounding areas, such as Pembroke, sometimes the trip with transfers is almost 2 hours.

review_title: I throughly enjoyed my time here. I met great students
pros: Great work-life balance. Make a strong difference among students
cons: communication between the different levels, work can be stressful at times

review_title: Local employer, not good option as a career
cons: Few people know the profession. It is a job where you learn a task. Innovation is discouraged.

job_title: Tech Aide I in Wilmington, IL
pros: Flexible schedule. Good people to work with.
cons: Very little room for advancement. Low pay for the work performed.

pros: I Enjoyed it. Great people!  Awesome Plants!
